issue.title: [Release] Validate non-RC source and binary artifacts
issue.body:
***Note**: This issue was originally created as [ARROW-5107](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-5107). Please see the [migration documentation](https://gist.github.com/toddfarmer/12aa88361532d21902818a6044fda4c3) for further details.*

### Original Issue Description:
The release verification script has the following signature:
 `dev/release/verify-release.sh source|binaries X.Y.Z RC`

Which makes it impossible to verify actual (non-rc) releases.

It could be useful to test already released artifacts, like:
`dev/release/verify-release.sh source|binaries X.Y.Z`

comments.body:
***Note**: [Comment](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-5107?focusedCommentId=16809293) by Kouhei Sutou (kou):*
This is `verify-release-cndidate.sh`. So adding support for release (not candidate) is odd.
It's OK to me that we rename `verify-release-candidate.sh` to `verify-release.sh` and it supports both release and release candidate.

***Note**: [Comment](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-5107?focusedCommentId=16809649) by Krisztian Szucs (kszucs):*
Indeed, updated the description.
